message.content:
cs.MA, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with a problem of multi-agent coordination, which is a central topic in the field of multi-agent systems (MAS). The use of mobile agents and the focus on their motion rules suggest that the paper belongs to the sub-category of "Multiagent Systems" (cs.MA). The fact that the agents have limited visibility and sensing capabilities, and that the paper proposes a solution based on geometrical considerations, suggests that it could also belong to the sub-categories of "Robotics" (cs.RO) and "Systems and Control" (cs.SY). The use of a simple rule of motion and the focus on the convergence of the agents to a common meeting point suggest that the paper could also belong to the sub-categories of "Data Structures and Algorithms" (cs.DS) and "Artificial Intelligence" (cs.AI).
